question.text: Which statement is not true for Drosophila melanogaster?

options.text: They complete their life cycle in about two weeks.
Single mating produce a large number of progeny flies.
It has few hereditary variations that can be seen with a high power microscope.
It has a clear differentiation of the sex.

solution.text: Drosophila Melanogaster, the fruit fly, is a great organism for genetic use because it has simple food requirements, occupies little space, completes its life cycle in 12 days, makes a large number of offspring, can be knocked out easily, and it has many types of hereditary variations that can be seen with low power microscopes. Drosophila has a small number of chromosomes, four pairs. They are easily located in the large salivary glands.
